caption: This site is my first choice site.  Of all restaurants I know I favor it most. I never miss an opportunity to go to visit this place. everytime  I I need a delicious dinner, this is the place that comes right away to my head. superb and varied  food and a rich cuisine.trained staff, and great ambience. And very important, the price is reasonable. I sent my friends to this spot with no hesitation.
I had an amazing  in this place. We liked the amazing atmosphere and the food. The staff were very affable. I’m content we ultimately decided to visit this restaurant.

Old school Italian restaurant, with some staple dishes. Cozy spot with a lovely garden. Friendly staff , one of my top 3 pizza spots in the city. I celebrated my birthday at Monte's (small group of close friends), had fantastic time, felt like home. Thank you Maria Rosa and Jovan, and the rest of the team
The service was great, and the food was excellent.

I remember when I used to like this place. I guess there are new owners. The staff was horrible at best. I have had better pasta from a can. I will never spend another cent here. The blankets were not marked that you were charging people $20.00 to use them. Also a quick note if your staff explained themselves and treated customers as humans maybe all of these issues would not have been issues at all.
A decent place prices are decent to but not many menu options outside of pasta. Food wasn't bad though.
Great pizza, awesome atmosphere, professional and cool. Good for family gatherings.

Service, atmosphere and staff top notch ! We came last night and sat in the back garden. They provided heat lamps that kept us warm and even sell blankets if you still feel cold (great idea as sharing isn't an option during these times). The hostess was warm and welcoming and made sure to take each persons temperature, staff are all wearing masks, and they strongly enforce the mask policy with guests as well.  We had the braised short ribs with mash potato, butternut squash ravioli, and the grilled octopus everything was delicious. I highly recommend and will be back soon to dine indoors. They have partitions throughout the restaurant see photo.

The hostess at the front was rude and as though she didn’t want to be bothered when we entered the establishment. Our waitress was not very attentive and was annoyed because we were not ordering at her pace....like she was in a rush.  Yes I get it we are are in challenging times due to COVID but this is not how you treat patrons who are PAYING for the meal. Not only did we have to deal with this, the food took about 40 minutes. I mean we only ordered pizza and pasta which are quick dishes.  The food was basic....marinara sauce was bland. My 9 year old daughter makes better sauce.  This restaurant does not even deserve the one star. The service and food are HORRIBLE and don’t waste your money in this place.
Classic place. Backyard is lovely, pizza is perfect.
I loved Monte's. The food was excellent and the service was great. I wanted to thank Alex our servicer for a great job. Thank Monte's.
Very cozy, food was delicious. The host/waitress was awesome!
Had a great time at Monte’s. Amazing food and great waitress. Will for sure go back .
purely amazing .  octopus is the bomb.

I had the Croque Madame from the brunch menu. It was pretty good, though the crust was a bit hard to cut (I was on a call, I think I just took too long too start eating after served). I didn't have the pizzas, but they looked good. I'd return.
Really good! Love all their pizzas and other food is yummy as well. Great for pickup or dine w the kids.
Amazing drinks and food! Can't wait to come back again.
Incredible service, incredible ambiance, and incredible food. The pasta is perfectly crafted and cooked. The pizza is delicious as are all the salads. Can't wait to come back again!
So quite and nice place, the food was amazing
(Translated by Google) Excellent meal  (Original) Excelente comida
Love this place. Can't wait to go back. If u r wondering about the shortrib, I say go for it. For me it is the best thing on the menu

Really solid old school Italian in Brooklyn. Sure I'll be back--the pastas were very good and the service was great. A bit of a hassle that they only take amex cards which made for a slightly awkward paying experience.
Great old school Italian Restraunt
Very nice American restaurant we had American pizza mmmm
Although the food  was good the waitress tried to pull a fast one- yes we had two bottles of water me but we were not drunk enough to pay our required tip twice  Shane on her
Not going back. Alot of hype over nothing.
I have had excellent meals here. I loved eating on the patio this summer, it is so nicely done, just lovely. The sauces are rich, the pasta is hearty.
Excellent atmosphere and super amiable service. The meals were fresh and delightful. Will easily recommend this spot to anyone. Fair prices and generous portions. Keep it up.

Walked in off the street with a group of 10. No issues seating us and providing us with an amazing meal. One of the oldest italian restaurants in the borough. Outstanding food and tasty. Pizza is good and the braised short ribs are off the hook. Parking is tough but can be found. Enjoy a taste of old school Brooklyn.
Food and service was excellent.
Great red sauce place with yummy pizza!
Service and food were both excellent
I have a seafood pasta that was excellent. Love the clams and mussels.
Good restaurant.  Food was well prepared.  Wait staff were courteous and attentive.
Great patio, high quality pasta and salad, friendly staff. Weird they only take AmEx and cash though
Cozy
good food
Excellent bin every way, food ,price , service and  ambiance.

The patio is the best feature of this restaurant. The food is just OK overall. Everything is just... bland. The red sauce is devoid of the most basic seasoning - no garlic,  basil, or oregano detected. Nonna would not be happy. The pizza looks pretty good.
Different from the old days but nice in its own way.

Great place, cool vibe. Chill relaxed, servers don’t rush you. Sat at at the bar with my girlfriend and a few other people to watch the derby last night. Place was packed! Which is a good sign!!  Food incredible, wood fired pizza that you can see them make from the dining room. Oven is the centerpiece of this restaurant and they make a bunch of dishes inside there other than pizza.  Had the wood oven mussels, really nice tasty and extremely fresh. Loved it so much we order another.  Pizza is crisp with airy crust and just the perfect amount of charring. Check out this one that we decided to take home with us. (Photo attached)  Really a must try. We will be back!

Love love love! Been coming here for the past few weeks now and every time I come I am always more impressed. From their wood fired pizza to their fresh made pasta you can not go wrong.  Try their fritto misto (fried calamari and shrimp) just the right amount of crips with a lightly spicy maranara sauce to accompany.  Or their grilled octopus (OUTSTANDING).  For pasta I have been enjoying the housemade Cavatelli in the wild boar ragù and the strozzapretti with sweet and spicy sausage in a vodka sauce. Both really well prepared I can not choose a favorite out of the two.  Dessert a must try is their famious Italian cheese cake. Fluffy, light and melts in your mouth.  Don’t even get me started on their metro pies! You will just have to see it for yourself! 😋  Check it out you won’t be disappointed.
Excellent food. Tiramisu was out of this world!
Great food, service excellent, desert delicious
Great red sauce Italian, very old, very traditional.
Traditional red sauce Italian done very well. A true Brooklyn tradition.

We came in around 10pm with a group of 8 and it was no problem at all. Focaccia on the house, the metro size buratta pizza was awesome and the wine great! What a great find! Here’s to another 113 years more!
Great pasta. Salad dressing too salty. Chicken marsala was ok. Large portions.
Monte's graciously hosted my Grandmother's 90th birthday. The food and service were top notch. We'll be back.
Service incredible Food very good
Great pizza and ambience.
Awesome pizza and a great atmosphere!
(Translated by Google) Good pizzas  (Original) Buenas pizzas

I pass by this place maybe 5 times a week and this weekend I finally said to my family let's try this restaurant. 0 regret. We had a fantastic time outside in their garden area, the service was perfect. We had some cheese and Italian meat to start and then a meter pizza. Everything was delicious. We had a fantastic time and I can not believe it took that long to try it. I know I will be back from more very very very soon. Thank you for the wonderful meal.

Had the wedding rehearsal dinner here. And I must say what a great location. The food was excellent and reasonably priced. The staff was very patient with our large party. The only problem was not enough restrooms. But since it's no building it is not going to be solved any time soon.  We had pizza and it was wonderful. What surprised me was the calamary. Not greasy at all and delicious. We did not have a badd item out of the 5 item served. Way to go Monte's.
Loved the clam pizza here. Great backyard and not too crowded.

A restaurant established in 1906 serving pizza flat breads , perfect calamari and a whole spectrum of Italian comfort foods. There is also a fully stocked bar. The restrooms are clean. Even when the phase is crowded

Had a great experience last night in this old and charming Brooklyn establishment. From the attentive dinner service at the bar, to the fresh and large oysters, to the wine and food, to sharing a glass of wine and conversation with the owners and some regular neighborhood patrons - this was an evening to remember. We think that we found our new favorite local tucked on a side street in Gowanus!  Brunch apparently is amazing so that is next on the agenda. Thank you, Monte's!
Love the pizza at this great neighborhood spot. The Pizza Reale, with eggplant and prociutto is spec-tacular!

I pass by this place maybe 5 times a week and this weekend I finally said to my family let's try this restaurant. 0 regret. We had a fantastic time outside in their garden area, the service was perfect. We had some cheese and Italian meat to start and then a meter pizza. Everything was delicious. We had a fantastic time and I can not believe it took that long to try it. I know I will be back from more very very very soon. Thank you for the wonderful meal.

One of the best pizzas you will ever have! Came with a large party of ten and the waitress was fantastic. She handled everything so well and was very pleasant. I travel from the Upper East Side of Manhattan just to have this pizza!
Terrific panini at lunch and great pizzas at dinner.

Strolled in here by chance for a drink on a Sunday afternoon. It’s been around since 1906 so naturally I had to try the pizza and was not disappointed. The Burrata pizza was one of the best I’ve ever had and warrants a return. If you’re looking for a great place off the beaten path give this a shot!

The food was incredible, tasty and extremely well prepared and served. Our server Anisa (Black hair with a beautiful accent) was attentive and knowledgeable. She recommended the arugula speck salad and the braised short rib. She also mentioned the pizza was delicious. Looking forward to trying that the next time we come in.

Food was amazing. The sad part was the waitress rushed us the whole night. Rushed us to order. Trying to take our food before we were done. Also made us use a cash machine to pay. Great meal ruined by service.  Thank you for the response but do to the service I would be hard pressed to return. I expect a minimal amount of service for that I pay. When I pay almost 100 a plate I expect to be left to dine at my pace. Rushed to eat, pay and leave really sours a night out. Especially when a night out is few and far between. Again, great food.  Try and worry about the customer more than the money.
Best pizza ever

I was hopeful about this restaurant based on the positive reviews and its history, but I didn't really enjoy the pasta. Moreover, I was at one of the two occupied tables at the time, and I had to listen to the cooks' constant cursing.
Oldest italian restaurant in Brooklyn, great food, wine, dessert, glad we finally made it there, adding it to the roster.

Incredible calamari, amazing pasta. I am usually sick of pizza ( my family eats it way too often) but I can never get tired of Monte's pizza. Seriously there are way too many pizza places in Brooklyn so if you have a hankering for a pie, come here. Oh and did I mention their ridiculously great happy hour and nightly specials?
Been in neighborhood for years...real old school Italian but taken over within the past couple of years. Still good. A hidden gem in Brooklyn (Gowanus)

I did not know what real fresh mozzarella cheese was until I had a Monte’s pizza!  Well managed and the staff understood their reputation is on the line with each and every order.  I’ve brought in a large group or just dined with my family - always GREAT!
Was a great place before they changed the menu bad
Excellent food & service. Enjoyed a great time, with family and friends.

I come here often! Place is amazing! Pizza is cooked to perfection in their wood burning oven. This is not your typical NY STYLE pizza people. This is authenitc neopolitan style pizza and they have amazing homemade pastas as well.  Try the Cavatelli it’s out of this world.  Service is outstanding. Wine selection and cocktail list change regularly.
Worst place ever from the food to the service to the management. Just awful!
Food was delicious Service was fantastic Great night out with friends
It was good. The food was well prepared with generous proportions and the service was excellent. They had free parking which saved a great deal of time and allowed us to not have walk in the cold.
Amazing food! Great atmosphere! Good people!
Awesome food.  Tiramisu unreal!
Great food and atmosphere. A little on the pricey side but there aren't a lot of places still around that were legitimate "rat pack" hangouts. Go for the food and enjoy the nostalgia.
Old School joint that makes very good pizza.  Cash or Amex only which is weird.
Great food been going there for years Anthony always makes you feel at home
Great food
Italian food is fresh and tasty
Like family' great food, great people, great fun!
Phenomenal Italian food in Brooklyn.  Have the duck ragu pasta.  You'll never forget it.
Great food. We love coming here for brunch and there's never a wait to be seated.
The wine came out too strongly in the marinara.
Fantastic food, my co-worker was right on th money for suggesting your facility. I will be back many times. Constintine (spelling) took great care of us.
Food is not fresh and they probably serve adulterated liquor. Everything is off
Love the food, love the staff; it's like going to a favorite aunt's house for your favorite meal
My favorite family Italian place in Brooklyn. The Best.

Classic, traditional "red-Italian". Nothing artisanal, nothing fussy. Loved the arancini (which they oddly called "fritters"). Baked clams could use more garlic. Great, basic gin martini was made with a generous pour. Pasta was al dente and did not appear to be precooked. Bucatini amatriciana was excellent as was  a double cut pork chop. We ate on a lovely outdoor patio on a beautiful September night as well. Loved it and recommend highly. Portions were generous and we took enough leftovers home (because we were stuffed!) that I have dinner for tomorrow too. No quarrel with the price at all.

We sit down and are asked if we'd like tap or bottled water. We say tap will be fine and proceed to pour ourselves some water when it arrives. Only after taking a few sips do we notice that the base of the bottle is covered in mold. Then we order an octopus carpaccio dish that when it came out smelled and tasted like it'd been pulled straight out of the filthy Gowanus canal close to where the restaurant is located. Needless to say we will not be returning.

A go to favorite of my wife & I, pizza very good. Same can be said of the main courses and they were very good also. Drinks are well made by the barkeep and the service staff TRULY MAKES YOU FEEL WELCOMED.

The real stars at Monte's? The sangria and focaccia, made by the chef as you watch (love open kitchens). My pasta dish was really delicious, the service is SO friendly and I just loved the ambiance of an old school, real Italian restaurant.  Bring cash, as I think they only accept American Express, if at all.
Best pizza I have had in 20+ years  Reminds me of Milano  Nice clean warm. Has parking

I live out of state and every time I visit Brooklyn I always go to Monte's.  They have the best Italian food, from their Sangria (red and white), appetizers, pizza, entrees down to their desserts, you can't beat it.  Monte's is reasonably priced and the atmosphere is old world romantic.  This is a family owned restaurant and everyone working there are very pleasant.  I highly recommend this restaurant if you live or visiting in Brooklyn.

This is what a neighborhood Italian restaurant should be: not fussy, with delicious food, friendly service, and adorable cats roaming the terrace in the back. The crab salad is delicious as are the pastas (though I did find the boar ragu a teeny bit on the dry side). I only had a taste of the pizza, but it was enough to know I need to go back and try more. The sangria is also yummy. Atmosphere is relaxed and overall, the restaurant is perfect for a casual dinner, whether for date night or just catching up with a friend.

Montes employers are racist they are rude to anyone that is hispanic or black they have horrible attitudes n the meatballs and pasta are tasteless the bread is cold n hard do not go there if you are not their kind they do not truly want to serve you.
